I just wanted to make sure the 2 separate pieces of pool noodle doesnt count as ‚Äúseparate‚Äù as defined in the manual

I think ‚Äúseparate‚Äù as defined is referring if we had fabric separating the 2 sections, right?

I suggest taking an extra look at the noted picture, and text under the picture.

If that doesn‚Äôt answer your question, the you may want to ask the GDC via the Official Q&A once it opens, and they will most likely tell you the exact same thing.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":27,"updated_at":"2025-01-06T19:53:21.334Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":316,"readers_count":315,"score":63.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":479505,"topic_slug":"bumper-padding-joints","display_username":"EricH","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":53872,"username":"ryanhubbs","name":"Ryan Hubbs","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryanhubbs/{size}/231107_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4212,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"#westandwithUkraine"},"post_url":"/t/bumper-padding-joints/479505/4","custom_user_title":"#westandwithUkraine","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3472852,"name":"Christopher149","username":"Christopher149","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/838e76/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-06T19:53:54.423Z","cooked":"

I think it is specifically calling out separate ‚Äúbumper segments‚Äù, but a pool noodle isn‚Äôt an entire bumper segment (which also requires separate fabric).

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":27,"updated_at":"2025-01-06T19:53:54.423Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":299,"readers_count":298,"score":149.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":479505,"topic_slug":"bumper-padding-joints","display_username":"Christopher149","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":53872,"username":"ryanhubbs","name":"Ryan Hubbs","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryanhubbs/{size}/231107_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14984,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC857 lead mentor / FTC10723+13284+15270 lead mentor"},"post_url":"/t/bumper-padding-joints/479505/5","custom_user_title":"FRC857 lead mentor / FTC10723+13284+15270 lead mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3472867,"name":"Christine Low","username":"SurfGear","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/surfgear/{size}/120560_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-06T20:02:21.939Z","cooked":"

‚ÄúI think ‚Äúseparate‚Äù as defined is referring if we had fabric separating the 2 sections, right?‚Äù

That is my understanding.

As in: If you make a 4-piece bumper, don‚Äôt have mitered pieces of foam hanging off the ends.

Bumper corner protection is a priority with the new rules. We just disassembled bumpers from last season - we have dust where we once had pool noodles wrapped around corners.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":27,"updated_at":"2025-01-06T20:02:21.939Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":284,"readers_count":283,"score":116.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":479505,"topic_slug":"bumper-padding-joints","display_username":"Christine Low","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":53872,"username":"ryanhubbs","name":"Ryan Hubbs","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryanhubbs/{size}/231107_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32239,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Bumper Queen"},"post_url":"/t/bumper-padding-joints/479505/6","custom_user_title":"Bumper Queen","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3472871,"name":"Squillo","username":"Squillo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/squillo/{size}/78981_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-06T20:03:21.767Z","cooked":"

Related question: they do not show the ‚Äúvertical noodle in the corner‚Äù (top left example) or the ‚Äúoverlapped padding in the corner‚Äù (top center example) made with separate bumper segments (i.e., four separate, linear bumpers). The only one they show made with separate segments is the (disallowed) mitered corners (bottom right example). Do you all think that separate, linear (not bent around a corner of the robot) bumper segments, with fabric wrapped around a vertical corner noodle (but only on a single bumper side) or around an extended padding sticking out into, and totally filling, the corner, are still allowed?

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":27,"updated_at":"2025-01-06T20:03:21.767Z","reply_count":5,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":272,"readers_count":271,"score":79.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":479505,"topic_slug":"bumper-padding-joints","display_username":"Squillo","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16187,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 2465 (Kaua'iBots)"},"post_url":"/t/bumper-padding-joints/479505/7","custom_user_title":"Team 2465 (Kaua'iBots)","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3472884,"name":"","username":"pigrammer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pigrammer/{size}/234083_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-06T20:14:26.549Z","cooked":"

That seems to be not allowed to me, as there is a gap in the corner. It depends if the part that sticks straight out is considered part of the corner or not. I believe it would be, and so the only? legal way to make 4-piece bumpers is to make them the corners, but that is something to ask through Q&A.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":27,"updated_at":"2025-01-06T20:14:26.549Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":236,"readers_count":235,"score":57.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":479505,"topic_slug":"bumper-padding-joints","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":16187,"username":"Squillo","name":"Squillo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/squillo/{size}/78981_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64857,"hidden":false,"trust_level":3,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"246 Software Lead"},"post_url":"/t/bumper-padding-joints/479505/8","custom_user_title":"246 Software Lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3472914,"name":"RoboGeek","username":"Aaron_Li","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/aaron_li/{size}/10195_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-06T20:31:57.549Z","cooked":"

Worth a Q&A. They‚Äôll add it for clarification (they did in the past)

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":27,"updated_at":"2025-01-06T20:31:57.549Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":223,"readers_count":222,"score":59.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":479505,"topic_slug":"bumper-padding-joints","display_username":"RoboGeek","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":16187,"username":"Squillo","name":"Squillo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/squillo/{size}/78981_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33067,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Seeking Knowledge; Failed Programming"},"post_url":"/t/bumper-padding-joints/479505/9","custom_user_title":"Seeking Knowledge; Failed Programming","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3472920,"name":"Joyful blessings ","username":"SEA1127","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sea1127/{size}/244524_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-06T20:37:51.538Z","cooked":"

Yes. Our team has previously used pool noodles as bumper material. What we now use is a big slab of packing foam that we have cut down to the appropriate size. An issue with using pool noodles is the firmness of them, and how they dont always cushion as expected, and will wear down a lot faster with big impacts compared to the foam. (Image below for refrence of foam block)

Six Foot Polyisocyanurate Foam Blocks-1750√ó750 11.1 KB

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":27,"updated_at":"2025-01-06T20:37:51.538Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":216,"readers_count":215,"score":63.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":479505,"topic_slug":"bumper-padding-joints","display_username":"Joyful blessings ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66163,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Joyful blessings "},"post_url":"/t/bumper-padding-joints/479505/10","custom_user_title":"Joyful blessings ","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3472960,"name":"kauree bellüíô‚ù§Ô∏è","username":"kib","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kib/{size}/208339_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-06T21:11:37.272Z","cooked":"

pretty sure you are fine! you should fit under the approved mitered section IF your cover is all one piece. i think separate mitered segments are specifically referring to when the mitered segments still have gapping that occur between them even when fully constructed. as you can see, the approved bumpers are all covered in one piece of fabric to act as the cover while the pool noodles are completely flush against one another.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":27,"updated_at":"2025-01-06T21:11:37.272Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":191,"readers_count":190,"score":38.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":479505,"topic_slug":"bumper-padding-joints","display_username":"kauree bellüíô‚ù§Ô∏è","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62469,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5437 team cap & driver | i love team 16"},"post_url":"/t/bumper-padding-joints/479505/11","custom_user_title":"5437 team cap & driver | i love team 16","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3472976,"name":"RoboGeek","username":"Aaron_Li","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/aaron_li/{size}/10195_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-06T21:14:36.902Z","cooked":"

Just for clarification, is this practice new for 2025 or has the team done this in the past?

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":27,"updated_at":"2025-01-06T21:14:36.902Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":187,"readers_count":186,"score":62.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":479505,"topic_slug":"bumper-padding-joints","display_username":"RoboGeek","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":66163,"username":"SEA1127","name":"Joyful blessings ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sea1127/{size}/244524_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33067,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Seeking Knowledge; Failed Programming"},"post_url":"/t/bumper-padding-joints/479505/12","custom_user_title":"Seeking Knowledge; Failed Programming","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3472987,"name":"Christine Low","username":"SurfGear","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/surfgear/{size}/120560_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-06T21:17:50.413Z","cooked":"

Yes. (vertical noodle in the corner).

However - keeping a vertical noodle exactly in the corner is non-trivial. I would fill all gaps and tape it in place. (aka ‚Äúfill the corner‚Äù. Like FILL the corner).

To quote someone VERY familiar with this topic: ‚ÄúFig. 8-7 is not exhaustive and should not be read as such.‚Äù
